cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas and 120 miles SSE of Port O’Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Harvey is moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast and is expected to slow dramatically, then meander near or just inland of the coast through the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port Aransas–Port O’Connor area (just south-west of Calhoun Port Authority, TX)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for this segment of coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Port Mansfield to Sargent TX; Storm Surge Warning from Port Mansfield to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast, including Calhoun County shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds possible; sustained 74–110 mph with higher gusts during Friday night–Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 6–12 ft above ground level along the Calhoun County coastline and Lavaca Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Catastrophic rainfall totals of 15–25 inches with localized amounts up to 35 inches possible, leading to life-threatening flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands.
